verses.verse: Furthermore <S%H453>Elihu<s%> <S%H6030>answered<s%> and <S%H559>said<s%>,
<S%H8085>Hear<s%> my <S%H4405>words<s%>, O ye <S%H2450>wise<s%> men; and give <S%H238>ear<s%> unto me, ye that have <S%H3045>knowledge<s%>.
For the <S%H241>ear<s%> <S%H974>trieth<s%> <S%H4405>words<s%>, as the <S%H2441>mouth<s%> <S%H2938>tasteth<s%> <S%H398>meat<s%>. mouth: Heb. palate
Let us <S%H977>choose<s%> to us <S%H4941>judgment<s%>: let us <S%H3045>know<s%> among ourselves what is <S%H2896>good<s%>.
For <S%H347>Job<s%> hath <S%H559>said<s%>, I am <S%H6663>righteous<s%>: and <S%H410>God<s%> hath taken <S%H5493>away<s%> my <S%H4941>judgment<s%>.
Should I <S%H3576>lie<s%> against my <S%H4941>right<s%>? my <S%H2671>wound<s%> is <S%H605>incurable<s%> without <S%H6588>transgression<s%>. my wound: Heb. mine arrow
What <S%H1397>man<s%> is like <S%H347>Job<s%>, who drinketh <S%H8354>up<s%> <S%H3933>scorning<s%> like <S%H4325>water<s%>?
Which <S%H732>goeth<s%> in <S%H2274>company<s%> with the <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity<s%>, and <S%H3212>walketh<s%> with <S%H7562>wicked<s%> <S%H582>men<s%>.
For he hath <S%H559>said<s%>, It <S%H5532>profiteth<s%> a <S%H1397>man<s%> nothing that he should <S%H7521>delight<s%> himself with <S%H430>God<s%>.

Therefore <S%H8085>hearken<s%> unto me, ye <S%H582>men<s%> of <S%H3824>understanding<s%>: far be <S%H2486>it<s%> from <S%H410>God<s%>, that he should do <S%H7562>wickedness<s%>; and from the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%>, that he should commit <S%H5766>iniquity<s%>. men: Heb. men of heart
For the <S%H6467>work<s%> of a <S%H120>man<s%> shall he <S%H7999>render<s%> unto him, and cause every <S%H376>man<s%> to <S%H4672>find<s%> according to his <S%H734>ways<s%>.
Yea, <S%H551>surely<s%> <S%H410>God<s%> will not do <S%H7561>wickedly<s%>, neither will the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> <S%H5791>pervert<s%> <S%H4941>judgment<s%>.
Who hath given him a <S%H6485>charge<s%> over the <S%H776>earth<s%>? or who hath <S%H7760>disposed<s%> the whole <S%H8398>world<s%>? the whole: Heb. all of it?
If he <S%H7760>set<s%> his <S%H3820>heart<s%> upon man, if he <S%H622>gather<s%> unto himself his <S%H7307>spirit<s%> and his <S%H5397>breath<s%>; man: Heb. him
All <S%H1320>flesh<s%> shall <S%H1478>perish<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%>, and <S%H120>man<s%> shall turn <S%H7725>again<s%> unto <S%H6083>dust<s%>.
If now thou hast <S%H998>understanding<s%>, <S%H8085>hear<s%> this: <S%H238>hearken<s%> to the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of my <S%H4405>words<s%>.
Shall even he that <S%H8130>hateth<s%> <S%H4941>right<s%> <S%H2280>govern<s%>? and wilt thou <S%H7561>condemn<s%> him that is <S%H3524>most<s%> <S%H6662>just<s%>? govern: Heb. bind?
Is it fit to <S%H559>say<s%> to a <S%H4428>king<s%>, Thou art <S%H1100>wicked<s%>? and to <S%H5081>princes<s%>, Ye are <S%H7563>ungodly<s%>?

How much less to him that <S%H5375>accepteth<s%> not the <S%H6440>persons<s%> of <S%H8269>princes<s%>, nor <S%H5234>regardeth<s%> the <S%H7771>rich<s%> more <S%H6440>than<s%> the <S%H1800>poor<s%>? for they all are the <S%H4639>work<s%> of his <S%H3027>hands<s%>.

In a <S%H7281>moment<s%> shall they <S%H4191>die<s%>, and the <S%H5971>people<s%> shall be <S%H1607>troubled<s%> at <S%H2676>midnight<s%> <S%H3915><s%>, and pass <S%H5674>away<s%>: and the <S%H47>mighty<s%> shall be taken <S%H5493>away<s%> without <S%H3027>hand<s%>. the mighty: Heb. they shall take away the mighty
For his <S%H5869>eyes<s%> are upon the <S%H1870>ways<s%> of <S%H376>man<s%>, and he <S%H7200>seeth<s%> all his <S%H6806>goings<s%>.
There is no <S%H2822>darkness<s%>, nor shadow of <S%H6757>death<s%>, where the <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity<s%> may <S%H5641>hide<s%> themselves.
For he will not <S%H7760>lay<s%> upon <S%H376>man<s%> more than right; that he should <S%H1980>enter<s%> into <S%H4941>judgment<s%> with <S%H410>God<s%>. enter: Heb. go
He shall break in <S%H7489>pieces<s%> mighty <S%H3524>men<s%> without <S%H2714>number<s%>, and <S%H5975>set<s%> <S%H312>others<s%> in their stead. number: Heb. searching out
Therefore he <S%H5234>knoweth<s%> their <S%H4566>works<s%>, and he <S%H2015>overturneth<s%> them in the <S%H3915>night<s%>, so that they are <S%H1792>destroyed<s%>. destroyed: Heb. crushed
He <S%H5606>striketh<s%> them <S%H8478>as<s%> wicked <S%H7563>men<s%> in the <S%H4725>open<s%> <S%H7200>sight<s%> of others; open: Heb. place of beholders
Because they turned <S%H5493>back<s%> from <S%H310>him<s%>, and would not <S%H7919>consider<s%> any of his <S%H1870>ways<s%>: him: Heb. after him
So that they cause the <S%H6818>cry<s%> of the <S%H1800>poor<s%> to <S%H935>come<s%> unto him, and he <S%H8085>heareth<s%> the <S%H6818>cry<s%> of the <S%H6041>afflicted<s%>.

When he giveth <S%H8252>quietness<s%>, who then can make <S%H7561>trouble<s%>? and when he <S%H5641>hideth<s%> his <S%H6440>face<s%>, who then can <S%H7789>behold<s%> him? whether it be done against a <S%H1471>nation<s%>, or against a <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H3162>only<s%>:
That the <S%H120>hypocrite<s%> <S%H2611><s%> <S%H4427>reign<s%> not, lest the <S%H5971>people<s%> be <S%H4170>ensnared<s%>.
Surely it is meet to be <S%H559>said<s%> unto <S%H410>God<s%>, I have <S%H5375>borne<s%> chastisement, I will not <S%H2254>offend<s%> any more:
That which I <S%H2372>see<s%> <S%H1107>not<s%> <S%H3384>teach<s%> thou me: if I have <S%H6466>done<s%> <S%H5766>iniquity<s%>, I will <S%H3254>do<s%> no more.

Should it be according to thy mind? he will <S%H7999>recompense<s%> it, whether thou <S%H3588>refuse<s%> <S%H3988><s%>, or whether thou <S%H977>choose<s%>; and not I: therefore <S%H1696>speak<s%> what thou <S%H3045>knowest<s%>. according: Heb. from with thee?
Let <S%H582>men<s%> of <S%H3824>understanding<s%> <S%H559>tell<s%> me, and let a <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H1397>man<s%> <S%H8085>hearken<s%> unto me. of: Heb. of heart
<S%H347>Job<s%> hath <S%H1696>spoken<s%> without <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>, and his <S%H1697>words<s%> were without <S%H7919>wisdom<s%>.

My <S%H15>desire<s%> <S%H1><s%> is that <S%H347>Job<s%> may be <S%H974>tried<s%> unto the <S%H5331>end<s%> because of his <S%H8666>answers<s%> for <S%H205>wicked<s%> <S%H582>men<s%>. My: or, My father, let Job be tried
For he <S%H3254>addeth<s%> <S%H6588>rebellion<s%> unto his <S%H2403>sin<s%>, he <S%H5606>clappeth<s%> his hands among us, and <S%H7235>multiplieth<s%> his <S%H561>words<s%> against <S%H410>God<s%>.
